gurmukhi: m`q gieMdn ieMdR bDU Bunswr Ctw riv kI jIA jwnI ]
transliteration: Matt Gadndan Indra Badhoo Bhnsaar Chhataa Rav(i) Kijeea Jaanee||
translation: She appeared as power-incarnate and the beauty of the sun at dawn to the intoxicated elephants.

gurmukhi: dyvn dyKn kI hrqw Ar dyvn kwl kiRXw kr mwnI ]
transliteration: Devan Dokhan Kihartaa Ar Devan Kaal Kridaa Kar Maanee||
translation: To the gods she seemed like the destroyer of sufferings and the performer of the religious activities of all kinds.

gurmukhi: dysn isMD idsysn biRMD jogysn gMg kY rMg pCwnI ]263]
transliteration: Desan Sindh Disesan Brindh Jogesan Gadg Kai Ran Pachhaadee||263||
translation: She appeared as the ocean to the earth, all-pervading to all the directions and pure like Ganges to the Yogis.263.

gurmukhi: auq rGubr bn ko cly sIA sihq qij gRyh ]
transliteration: Out Raghoubar Ban Ko Chale Seea Sahit Taj(i) Greh||
translation: On that side leaving home alongwith Sita, Ram went to the foest,

gurmukhi: ieqY dsw ijh ibiD BeI skl swD suin lyh ]264]
transliteration: Itai Dasaa Jih Bidh(i) Bhaisakal Saadh Soun(i) Leh||264||
translation: And on this side in Ayodhyapuri whatever happened, the saints may listen to that.264.

gurmukhi: sBY suK lY ky gey gwVo duK dyq Bey rwjw dsrQ jU k`au kY kY Awj pwq ho ]
transliteration: Sabhai Soukh Lai Ke Gad Gaddo Doukh Det Bhae Raajaa Dasrath Joo Kau Kai Kai Aaj Paat Ho||
translation: They had taken all the comforts with them and giving us great agony, they have left us to see also the agony of the death of king Dasrath.

gurmukhi: Aj hUM n CIjY bwq mwn lIjY rwj kIjY kho kwj kaun kO hmwry sRoxnwQ ho ]
transliteration: Aj Hoon Na Chheejai Baat Maan Leejai Raaj Keejai Kaho Kaaj Kaoun Kau Hamdare Sron-naath Ho||
translation: The king ram, seeing and listening to all this, is not softening, O Ram ! accept now whatever we say, please tell, who is the survivor Lord here?

gurmukhi: rwjsI ky DwrO swj swDn kY kIjY kwj kho rGurwj Awj kwhy k`au isDwq ho ]
transliteration: Raajasike Dhaarau Saaj Saadhan Kai Keejai Kaaj Kaho Raaghuraaj Aaj Kaahe Kau Sidhaat Ho||
translation: O Ram ! take the reins of kingdom and do all the work. Tell us, why are you going now?

gurmukhi: qwpsI ky Bys kIny jwnkI kO sMg lIny myry bnbwsI mo audwsI dIey jwq ho ]265]
transliteration: Taapasike Bhes Keene Jaanakikau San Leene Dere Banbaasimo Udaasideee Jaat Ho||265||
translation: O exiled Ram in the garb of an ascetic and taking Janaki (Sita) with you, why are you giving me sadness?265.

gurmukhi: kwry kwry kir bys rwjw jU kO Coir dys qwpsI ko kY Bys swiQ hI isDwir hO ]
transliteration: Kdare Kdare Kar(i) Bes Raajaa Joo Ko Chhodh(i) Des Taapasiko Kai Kai Bhes Saath(i) Hisiddaar(i) Haoun||
translation: I shall also put on the black garb leaving the country of the king, and becoming an ascetic, I shall accompany you.

gurmukhi: kul hUM kI kwn CoroN rwjsI ky rwj qoroN sMig qy n moroN muK AYso kY ibcwir hO ]
transliteration: Kul Hoon Kikaan Chhodhon Raajasike Raaj Toron San(i) Ten A Moron Moukh Aiso Kai Bicdaar(i) Haoun||
translation: I shall leave the family practice and abandon the royal splendour, but shall not turn my face away from you.
